In January 1979, Tehran was rocked by surging protests in support of Grand Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, then in exile in Paris.
Amid the rioting in January, Iran’s autocratic leader, Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, went into exile, dooming his government, which collapsed on Feb. 11, 1979.
Employees and diplomats at the United States Embassy in Tehran were taken hostage in November 1979, leading to a breach in relations between the two countries.
A site in Tehran known as the tomb of the unknown martyrs, dedicated to Iranians killed in the 1980-88 war with Iraq.

صورة سيلفي التقطتها الشيخة لطيفة وهي تبتسم ابتسامةً عريضةً مع تينا جاوياين، صديقتها ومدربة كابويرا، فيما كانتا تعبران الحدود نحو سلطنة عُمان في آذار/مارس الماضي.
هيرفي جوبير، إلى اليمين، تحدث في مؤتمر في لندن بعد أن تم إلقاء القبض على الشيخة لطيفة على متن يخته. قال والد الشيخة لطيفة أنّ السيد جوبير كان قد خطفها.

من أجل التأكيد أن الشيخة لطيفة تعيش في بيتها بأمان، نشرت الحكومة الإماراتية في كانون الأول/ديسمبر هذه الصورة التي تظهر فيها الشيخة لطيفة بنت محمد آل مكتوم، إلى اليسار، مع ماري روبنسون الرئيسة السابقة لإيرلندا.

Caption: Aurora borealis over Canada, as seen from the International Space Station in 2017. The spectacular display is caused by charged particles from the sun interacting with Earth's magnetic field.

The north magnetic pole is distinct from the geographic north pole, which is where all the lines of longitude meet at the top of the world. The magnetic pole is the point that compasses recognize as north.
A changing magnetic pole will require repainting the headings on airport runways. The shift also affects navigation on flights with routes over the geographic North Pole.

Caption: The last Elfstedentocht, a one-day distance race through 11 Dutch cities, was held in 1997.
A search for an alternative site for the race eventually led Dutch skaters to Weissensee, Austria.
Skating outfits hung as decorations from hotel balconies. A Dutch airline now offers direct flights to the region.
Marieke Lassche, 59, skated the traditional Elfstedentocht in 1986, when she was 26.
Below-zero temperatures greeted this year's competitors at the predawn start. The 200-kilometer course takes hours to complete.
Klasina Seinstra, 50, was the first woman across the finish line at the 1997 Elfstedentocht, the last held in the Netherlands. She has been traveling to Weissensee for 27 years.
Erben Wennemars, 43, is a former world champion and Olympic medalist but, he said, “I would throw it all away for the Elfstedentocht.”
A skater warmed her hands after abandoning the race. Other injuries included cuts and broken bones from falls on the uneven ice.
Raisin bread and hot tea are provided on the course.

Caption: The office of Walter Gropius, the founder of the Bauhaus art and architecture school, in Weimar, Germany, the institution’s first home when it was established in 1919. The room was reconstructed by Gerhard Oschmann in 1999.

Design of desk, armchair F51, sofa and ceiling lamp by Walter Gropius. Carpet by Benita Koch-Otte. Bethel by friendly permission of V. Bodelschwingh Foundation Bethel©. Caption: The exhibition “A Place of Memory” gives a taste of how the Prado, Spain’s national museum, has navigated the choppy waters of the country’s politics.

A 1932 photograph showing a crowd of rural folk viewing a copy of Velázquez’s “The Spinners” in Cebreros, Spain. During the 1930s, copies of masterpieces from the Prado’s collection toured the country in a civic education program.
During the Spanish Civil War, important items from the Prado’s collection were evacuated, eventually to Geneva.

Keylis, 28, top, and Hainni, 17, below left, at La Yaguara Detention Center, Caracas, chat with male prisoners locked up just a few meters away from them. March 2018.
Twenty-two female detainees await trial for months or even years at La Yaguara Detention Center. They are packed into a 9-by-12-foot cell where most sleep on mattresses on the floor. March 2018.
Scars on a female detainee’s legs at La Alcaidesa, Merida, that she said were the result of fights. Many women also injure themselves. November 2018.

Yusbelis Bustamante, 23, cries while showing her injuries from a fight with another inmate at La Yaguara Detention Center, Caracas. She is 4 months pregnant, but in her seven weeks of detention, she had not received any medical checkups. November 2018.

Leslie Smith, right, and his mother Lucretia Chapple, left, pose for a photo at an official visit to the University of Pittsburgh. He has since signed with the college. The Smiths are part of a growing trend of parents who like to pose with their children in college signing photos.

Caption: To get three perfectly cut yolks showcased in all three portions of your sandwich, positioning is crucial: Arrange the soft-boiled eggs down the center of the bread, placing the more narrow tip of each egg toward the crust and and wider, yolk-filled portions toward the center.
Credit/Source: Lisa Corson for The New York Times

Caption: Cutting off two edges of crust creates a striking visual, but also helps guide cooks to ensure they're cutting the sandwich correctly. You'll want to cut the sandwich into three even sections cutting parallel to the remaining crust to ensure you're revealing the yolks, then standing the sandwiches up so the yolks can be seen.
Credit/Source: Lisa Corson for The New York Times

Caption: The autobahn near Munich. As far as quasi-religious national obsessions go, the German aversion to speed limits is up there with gun control in America.
Painting the autobahn’s surface before the inauguration of the highway between Berlin and Magdeburg in 1936.
Karl Benz seated on the 1885 Benz Motorwagen, the first motor vehicle to be sold to the public.
A storage facility at Volkswagen, the German carmaker. In Germany, cars are not only the proudest export item but also a symbol of national identity.
Boeing’s 737 Max is the latest version of a plane that first went into service half a century ago.

A 737 simulator being used by Lion Air aviation students. The Federal Aviation Administration decided that 737 pilots would not have to undergo additional simulator training to fly the new Boeing 737 Max.
A Boeing employee examines wiring on a 737 Max at the company’s plant in Renton, Wash.
The 737 Max was Boeing’s response to a more fuel-efficient version of its archrival Airbus’s A320 jetliner.
The larger, more fuel-efficient engines Boeing wanted for the 737 Max led to a change in the flight control system that was never highlighted for pilots.
Lion Air Flight 610, a Boeing 737 Max, crashed into the Java Sea off Indonesia on Oct. 29, killing all 189 people on board.

Caption: The Turnberry golf resort in Scotland was the subject of a previously undisclosed loan request by the Trump Organization during the 2016 presidential campaign, two people familiar with the request said. Deutsche Bank turned down the application.
Donald J. Trump at the Turnberry resort in June 2016, when he was the presumptive Republican nominee for president. A Trump entity lent at least $45 million to the resort that year.
Deutsche Bank lent more than $100 million to the Trump Organization to finance its Doral resort in Miami. In 2016, the organization suggested expanding the Doral loans to fund work on Turnberry.
Rep. Adam Schiff wants to look closely at Deutsche Bank because it has previously paid regulatory penalties for laundering money for Russians.

Many Democratic candidates for president, like Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts, don’t want to wrestle publicly with the details of “Medicare for all,” which would most likely entail raising taxes.
Credit/Source: CreditTravis Dove for The New York Times

Caption: A Los Angeles rally supporting Medicare for all. Eighty-one percent of Democrats approve of the idea, according to a recent poll.
Representative Pramila Jayapal of Washington will soon become the main sponsor of a Medicare for All bill similar to the one led by Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont.
Bill Belichick has won five Super Bowls as the Patriots’ head coach. On Sunday, the team will play in the ninth Super Bowl of his tenure. Will an unheralded player help New England to a sixth title?
Patriots running back Antowain Smith ran for 92 yards in the team’s first Super Bowl victory, in 2002.
Malcom Butler sealed the Patriots’ fourth Super Bowl title by intercepting a goal-line pass intended for Ricardo Lockette, right, of the Seattle Seahawks.
Credit/Source: Mark J. Rebilas/USA Today Sports, via Reuters

Caption: The funeral last Sunday for Hamdy Naasan, who was killed in a melee involving Jewish settlers. The Israeli government has been reluctant to address a rise in attacks by settlers.
The settler outpost Adei Ad sits on a hill overlooking the Palestinian village of Al Mughayir in the West Bank.
The yeshiva Pri Haaretz, which the authorities say has links to messianic radicals, is in the West Bank settlement of Rehelim, which also runs a boutique winery.
Palestinian farmers heading to their olive groves, guarded by Israeli soldiers to reduce the possibility of confrontation with settlers in the nearby settlement of Rehelim.
Representatives of Adei Ad, in the foreground, initially said the armed force that attacked Al Mughayir had set out to rescue a group of hikers and to rule out a report that one was missing.

Caption: Silvia Limardo fetching a syringe for a customer at her family’s pharmacy in downtown Caracas in 2017. This pharmacy had a reputation for decades as being one of the best stocked in the city, but its shelves are now bare.
Credit/Source: Meridith Kohut for The New York Times

Caption: Lilian Tintori, center, the wife of Leopoldo López, an opposition politician jailed in 2014, continues to protest for his release.

Demonstrators outside the Capitol in Richmond, Va. Most Virginia Democratic leaders said privately that Mr. Northam would have little choice but to quit because he had lost support from nearly all his allies in the State Capitol.
Thousands of opposition activists demonstrating in the streets of Caracas, Venezuela, on Saturday.
Credit/Source: CreditMeridith Kohut for The New York Times

Caption: Whether protests alone can catalyze a shift in the political standoff in Venezuela is far from clear.

Caption: With the opposition leader Juan Guaidó calling on his supporters to follow him into the streets again on Saturday, there have been few times in Venezuela’s recent history when so much has appeared to be hanging on a protest.

Dr. Valerie Mechanik and Richard Westenberger dancing over the covered pool at their Tampa, Fla., home. Their first date was five hours long. Their second date almost didn’t happen.

Caption: Fernando Nunez led the couple in their vows, during which the couple said to each other: “I will kiss you unexpectedly and often.”

Caption: The couple share a laugh during a quick moment alone.
Credit/Source: Eve Edelheit for The New York Times

Caption: One table of guests at a time were called into the kitchen to find a French-themed dinner buffet waiting for them. The menu included speeches and toasts, as well as hors d’oeuvres, beef bourguignon, chicken cordon bleu and hoisin glazed salmon. Dessert featured a chocolate cake with a “Love, Love Me Do” cake topper.
Credit/Source: Eve Edelheit for The New York Times

Caption: Songs by the Beatles filled the night. “We’ve learned through all of the ups and downs that it’s not the material things that matter and that in the end,” the bride said, before borrowing a line from her favorite band, “all you need is love.”

Caption: David Opdyke’s new wall piece, “This Land,” a year in the making and fashioned out of more than 500 vintage postcards which he painted over to depict a future of environmental chaos.
Credit/Source: Ricky Rhodes for The New York Times

Caption: Detail from “This Land,” Mr. Opdyke’s dark portrait of a future world in thrall to global warming. He paints with gouache on vintage postcards: here, a forest aflame.
Credit/Source: Ricky Rhodes for The New York Times

Caption: The artist, here in his studio in Ridgewood, Queens, hopes his piece might change people’s vision, “one person at a time,” as one way of helping “to provoke an appropriate mass response.”
Credit/Source: Ricky Rhodes for The New York Times

Caption: A traffic jam coils endlessly off into the distance.
Credit/Source: Ricky Rhodes for The New York Times

Caption: In Mr. Opdyke’s fevered vision, an orange grove is decimated by freeze.
Credit/Source: Ricky Rhodes for The New York Times

Caption: A soft, wearable patch measures the chemical contents of sweat on the skin. It could be used to screen for cystic fibrosis, and give athletes real-time performance data.
Sweat enters the device through tiny holes and flows through a network of microchannels, each the width of a hair. Sensors detect specific chemicals such as glucose and lactate.

Caption: Sacks of seized pangolin scales were displayed by Hong Kong customs officials on Friday, along with elephant tusks they said were found in the same shipment.
A pangolin and its baby at a zoo in Bali, Indonesia. There are lucrative black markets for pangolin scales in China and Vietnam, where they are used in traditional Chinese medicine.
Officials said the scales and tusks were hidden under slabs of frozen meat on a cargo ship bound for Vietnam from Nigeria.
Hong Kong has long been a port of entry for illegal wildlife products.

During the Spanish Civil War, important items from the Prado’s collection were evacuated, eventually to Geneva.

هيرفي جوبير، إلى اليمين، تحدث في مؤتمر في لندن بعد أن تم إلقاء القبض على الشيخة لطيفة على متن يخته. قال والد الشيخة لطيفة أنّ السيد جوبير كان قد خطفها.

من أجل التأكيد أن الشيخة لطيفة تعيش في بيتها بأمان، نشرت الحكومة الإماراتية في كانون الأول/ديسمبر هذه الصورة التي تظهر فيها الشيخة لطيفة بنت محمد آل مكتوم، إلى اليسار، مع ماري روبنسون الرئيسة السابقة لإيرلندا.

Caption: Aurora borealis over Canada, as seen from the International Space Station in 2017. The spectacular display is caused by charged particles from the sun interacting with Earth's magnetic field.

The north magnetic pole is distinct from the geographic north pole, which is where all the lines of longitude meet at the top of the world. The magnetic pole is the point that compasses recognize as north.
A changing magnetic pole will require repainting the headings on airport runways. The shift also affects navigation on flights with routes over the geographic North Pole.

Caption: Mr. Truong has been developing a recipe for Peking goose, which requires separating the skin with an air compressor and three days of drying in the refrigerator before it's roasted and basted in its own fat.

Caption: Mr. Truong and Ms. Owen aim to eat only meat and fish they kill themselves. At a recent post-hunt lunch, they piled slices of Peking goose on flour tortillas smeared with hoisin sauce.

Caption: The last Elfstedentocht, a one-day distance race through 11 Dutch cities, was held in 1997.
A search for an alternative site for the race eventually led Dutch skaters to Weissensee, Austria.
Skating outfits hung as decorations from hotel balconies. A Dutch airline now offers direct flights to the region.
Marieke Lassche, 59, skated the traditional Elfstedentocht in 1986, when she was 26.
Below-zero temperatures greeted this year's competitors at the predawn start. The 200-kilometer course takes hours to complete.
Klasina Seinstra, 50, was the first woman across the finish line at the 1997 Elfstedentocht, the last held in the Netherlands. She has been traveling to Weissensee for 27 years.
Erben Wennemars, 43, is a former world champion and Olympic medalist but, he said, “I would throw it all away for the Elfstedentocht.”
A skater warmed her hands after abandoning the race. Other injuries included cuts and broken bones from falls on the uneven ice.
Raisin bread and hot tea are provided on the course.
Jim Buck, perhaps the first professional dog walker, and his charges, near Central Park. March 5, 1964.
On zebra skin, 1948.
Surveying Midtown Manhattan, through a sunroof. Dec. 17, 1975.

The New River, which flows across the border between Calexico, Ca., and Mexicali, Mexico, has long been contaminated with sewage and industrial waste.
Credit/Source: CreditEmily Kask for The New York Times

Caption: Debris left by the river. Efforts to clean up the pollution and waste on the American side have faced long delays.

Caption: State lawmakers have noted that the river is believed to carry pathogens that cause tuberculosis, encephalitis, polio, cholera, hepatitis, and typhoid.

Caption: Many have called for enclosing the river and diverting its waters to filter out pollutants.
Credit/Source: Emily Kask for The New York Times

Caption: Many along the border have groused about funding for water treatment projects not going to the American side.
Credit/Source: Emily Kask for The New York Times

Caption: The office of Walter Gropius, the founder of the Bauhaus art and architecture school, in Weimar, Germany, the institution’s first home when it was established in 1919. The desk, armchair, sofa and ceiling lamp were originally by Gropius, the table lamp is by Wilhelm Wagenfeld and the carpet is by Benita Koch-Otte. The room was reconstructed by Gerhard Oschmann in 1999.
Credit/Source: Photograph by Fabrice Fouillet. Walter Gropius, “Gropius Room,” 1922/23 © 2019 ARS, NY/VG Bild-Kunst, Bonn, Reconstruction as a “Gesamtkunstwerk” by Gerhard Oschmann 1998/99. Design of desk, armchair F51, sofa and ceiling lamp by Walter Gropius. Carpet by Benita Koch-Otte. Bethel by friendly permission of V. Bodelschwingh Foundation Bethel©. Caption: The Gropius-designed Monument to the March Dead, constructed in Weimar in 1922 to commemorate the workers who lost their lives resisting the Kapp Putsch, a failed attempt to overthrow the Weimar Republic. Destroyed by the Nazis in 1936, it was rebuilt 10 years later.

Once ingested, a tiny device called Soma positions itself against the stomach wall and injects insulin into the bloodstream.
The pill’s shape was inspired by the leopard tortoise. Its shell helps the tortoise right itself if it gets tipped over.

Frank Robinson in the second game of the 1969 World Series, in which the Baltimore Orioles faced the Mets. Robinson, who began his career with the Cincinnati Reds and was traded to the Orioles after the 1965 season, had 586 career home runs and 2,943 career hits, played on five pennant-winning teams and was elected to the Baseball Hall of Fame in his first year of eligibility.
On April 8, 1975, Robinson made his debut as the majors’ first black manager, with the Cleveland Indians.
Frank Robinson, right, with Hank Aaron after they were both voted into the Hall of Fame in 1982.
Robinson watched the unveiling of his bronze sculpture at Camden Yards in Baltimore in 2012. The Cincinnati Reds and the Cleveland Indians have also erected statues of him at their stadiums.

Caption: The exhibition “A Place of Memory” gives a taste of how the Prado, Spain’s national museum, has navigated the choppy waters of the country’s politics.
The Prado’s building was commissioned in the 1780s as a museum for natural sciences, but it opened to the public in 1819 as a gallery to showcase the royal art collection.

A 1932 photograph showing a crowd of rural folk viewing a copy of Velázquez’s “The Spinners” in Cebreros, Spain. During the 1930s, copies of masterpieces from the Prado’s collection toured the country in a civic education program.
During the Spanish Civil War, important items from the Prado’s collection were evacuated, eventually to Geneva.

Twenty-two female detainees await trial for months or even years at La Yaguara Detention Center. They are packed into a 9-by-12-foot cell where most sleep on mattresses on the floor. March 2018.
Scars on a female detainee’s legs at La Alcaidesa, Merida, that she said were the result of fights. Many women also injure themselves. November 2018.

Yusbelis Bustamante, 23, cries while showing her injuries from a fight with another inmate at La Yaguara Detention Center, Caracas. She is 4 months pregnant, but in her seven weeks of detention, she had not received any medical checkups. November 2018.

Aurora borealis over Canada, as seen from the International Space Station in 2017. The spectacular display is caused by charged particles from the sun interacting with Earth's magnetic field.

The north magnetic pole is distinct from the geographic north pole, which is where all the lines of longitude meet at the top of the world. The magnetic pole is the point that compasses recognize as north.
A changing magnetic pole will require repainting the headings on airport runways. The shift also affects navigation on flights with routes over the geographic North Pole.

Caption: To get three perfectly cut yolks showcased in all three portions of your sandwich, positioning is crucial: Arrange the soft-boiled eggs down the center of the bread, placing the more narrow tip of each egg toward the crust and and wider, yolk-filled portions toward the center.

Caption: Cutting off two edges of crust creates a striking visual, but also helps guide cooks to ensure they're cutting the sandwich correctly. Caption: From 1983 to 1985, punks including Perry Farrell and Aaron Sherer from Psi Com trekked to the Mojave Desert to attend D.I.Y. concerts that were part of Desolation Center.
Thurston Moore called his band’s Desolation Center performance “one of the great moments” in the history of Sonic Youth.
Einstürzende Neubauten destroyed an array of power tools during its cacophonous performance in 1984.
“I felt this compulsion to take music out of nightclubs,” the Desolation Center organizer Stuart Swezey said.

Caption: Houston Oilers running back Earl Campbell being tackled against the Cleveland Browns in 1983. “When you get out of pro football, you start having these operations,” said Campbell, who was confronted a decade ago by his family about his drug use. “I didn’t realize what I had until I got out of rehab.”
Aaron Gibson on a cold day in 2004 as a Chicago Bear. In retirement he was taking as many as 200 pills a day before he got off them.

Struggling with drug addiction, McDonald Oden, who played for the Cleveland Browns in the 1980s, ended up in a homeless shelter in Florida before the N.F.L. Player Care Foundation helped him get sober. "Drugs and alcohol ruined my career. In the N.F.L., your teammates, most of the guys were doing the same thing. I've been fighting this demon for over 30 years."
Credit/Source: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times

Caption: Eric Hipple,  former quarterback with the Detroit Lions, struggled with addiction after leaving the N.F.L. "It’s like grief, a psychological issue of rejection, so you turn to something you used in the past,” Hipple said.
Credit/Source: Scott McIntyre for The New York Times

Caption: Todd Gurley led the N.F.L. in total touchdowns this season with 21 despite starting only 14 games.
Brandin Cooks proved to be a terrific pickup for Jared Goff and the Rams, with the speedy wide receiver piling up 1,204 yards.
There are few things more demoralizing for an opponent than Julian Edelman’s consistent ability to generate first downs.
Sony Michel has been terrific in the playoffs, combining for 242 rushing yards and 5 touchdowns in the Patriots’ two victories.
Aaron Donald’s ability to create consistent inside pressure against opposing quarterbacks could be one of the biggest factors in deciding the game in the Rams’ favor.
A photograph from the 1984 medical school yearbook page of Mr. Northam showing a person dressed as a member of the Ku Klux Klan and another wearing blackface.

Demonstrators outside the Capitol in Richmond, Va. Most Virginia Democratic leaders said privately that Mr. Northam would have little choice but to quit because he had lost support from nearly all his allies in the State Capitol.
Crowds at Orlando International Airport in Florida on Saturday. Part of the airport was evacuated after an apparent suicide, the authorities said.
Justin E. Fairfax, the lieutenant governor of Virginia, would become the only current African-American governor in the United States if Ralph Northam answers calls to resign.

Caption: The Turnberry golf resort in Scotland was the subject of a previously undisclosed loan request by the Trump Organization during the 2016 presidential campaign, two people familiar with the request said. Deutsche Bank turned down the application.
Donald J. Trump at the Turnberry resort in June 2016, when he was the presumptive Republican nominee for president. A Trump entity lent at least $45 million to the resort that year.
Deutsche Bank lent more than $100 million to the Trump Organization to finance its Doral resort in Miami. In 2016, the organization suggested expanding the Doral loans to fund work on Turnberry.
Rep. Adam Schiff wants to look closely at Deutsche Bank because it has previously paid regulatory penalties for laundering money for Russians.

Many Democratic candidates for president, like Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts, don’t want to wrestle publicly with the details of “Medicare for all,” which would most likely entail raising taxes.
Credit/Source: CreditTravis Dove for The New York Times

Caption: A Los Angeles rally supporting Medicare for all. Eighty-one percent of Democrats approve of the idea, according to a recent poll.
Representative Pramila Jayapal of Washington will soon become the main sponsor of a Medicare for All bill similar to the one led by Senator Bernie Sanders of Vermont.
Bill Belichick has won five Super Bowls as the Patriots’ head coach. On Sunday, the team will play in the ninth Super Bowl of his tenure. Will an unheralded player help New England to a sixth title?
Patriots running back Antowain Smith ran for 92 yards in the team’s first Super Bowl victory, in 2002.
Malcom Butler sealed the Patriots’ fourth Super Bowl title by intercepting a goal-line pass intended for Ricardo Lockette, right, of the Seattle Seahawks.
Credit/Source: Mark J. Rebilas/USA Today Sports, via Reuters

Caption: The funeral last Sunday for Hamdy Naasan, who was killed in a melee involving Jewish settlers. The Israeli government has been reluctant to address a rise in attacks by settlers.
The settler outpost Adei Ad sits on a hill overlooking the Palestinian village of Al Mughayir in the West Bank.
The yeshiva Pri Haaretz, which the authorities say has links to messianic radicals, is in the West Bank settlement of Rehelim, which also runs a boutique winery.
Palestinian farmers heading to their olive groves, guarded by Israeli soldiers to reduce the possibility of confrontation with settlers in the nearby settlement of Rehelim.
Representatives of Adei Ad, in the foreground, initially said the armed force that attacked Al Mughayir had set out to rescue a group of hikers and to rule out a report that one was missing.
